intro: Trembleya hatschbachii, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to the harsh conditions of the Cape Peninsula. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid environment. Trembleya hatschbachii is a small, hardy plant that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
